solution_01_data_basics/02_proportion/05_read_frequency_distribution_prop_v3

video

The first 4 questions involve adding up relative frequencies of the indicated intervals. The last 4 questions can be done by guessing and checking until something works.


  1. (ANS=0.6077 \(\pm\) 0.01) There are 79 measurements less than 68. So, \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}<68]=\frac{79}{130}=0.6077\).
  2. (ANS=0.8923 \(\pm\) 0.01) There are 116 measurements more than 58. So, \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}>58]=\frac{116}{130}=0.8923\).
  3. (ANS=0.07692 \(\pm\) 0.01) There are 10 measurements closer than 1 units from 63. So, \(\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-63|<1]=0.07692\).
  4. (ANS=0.8615 \(\pm\) 0.01) There are 112 measurements further than 2 units from 58. So, \(\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-58|>2]=0.8615\).
  5. (ANS=68) First, \(0.6077 \cdot 130 = 79\). A boundary at \(b=68\) has 79 measurements less than it. So, \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}<68]=0.6077\).
  6. (ANS=56) First, \(0.9692 \cdot 130 = 126\). A boundary at \(b=56\) has 126 measurements more than it. So, \(\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}>56]=0.9692\).
  7. (ANS=2) First, \(0.1308 \cdot 130 = 17\). An interval with radius \(r=2\) around center 60 contains 17 measurements. So, \(\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-60|<2]=0.1308\).
  8. (ANS=6) First, \(0.4231 \cdot 130 = 55\). An interval with radius \(r=6\) around center 62 excludes 55 measurements. So, \(\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-62|<6]=0.4231\).
